alert.note: Alert for Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:17AM EST until December 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Greene and Ulster. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to runoff from heavy rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are likley in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hunter, Woodstock, Windham, Prattsville, Lanesville, Phoenicia, Mount Tremper, Woodland Valley Campground, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, West Shokan, North-South Lake Campground, Cairo, Shandaken, Durham, Ashland, Jewett, Lexington, Denning, Tannersville and Chichester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by email at ALB.stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany.
